contest-event.event-date: Oct. 6, 1945 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Overture for an Epic Occasion Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Foden's were barred for having achieved a hat trick in 1936-8. Denis Wright was appointed referee. Prizes: 1st: 200 Guineas 2nd: 150 Guineas 3rd: 75 Guineas 4th: 50 Guineas The 1945 Championship was the first sponsored by the Daily Herald Newspaper. The winners were announced by John Henry Iles OBE. The composers notes on his work described an "Epic Occasion" as "such as the overthrow of Nazidom". The contest started at 12.00 noon. The programme cost 6d and all proceeds went to the Great Ormond Street Hospital for Sick Children.
